alert.note: Alert for Southern Twin Falls County; Western Magic Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 8:24PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Twin Falls, western Jerome and southeastern Gooding Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 824 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hollister, or 11 miles southwest of Twin Falls, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Magic Valley Regional Airport around 830 PM MDT. Twin Falls, Filer, Kimberly and Hansen around 840 PM MDT. Eden around 850 PM MDT. Jerome and Minidoka National Monument around 900 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Southern Twin Falls County; Western Magic Valley
